p: Animal models have been developed to study HEV replication and pathogenesis. One animal model was developed in non-human primates: cynomolgus macaque ( Macaca fascicularis) [ 91] or less frequently chimpanzee [ 87]. The non-human primates were used mainly to study genotypes 1 and 2 HEV strains. A second animal model was developed in pigs [ 90] in which genotypes 3 and 4 replicate efficiently. Both non-human primate and pig models were used to demonstrate cross-species infections or extrahepatic sites of HEV replication [ 145]. More recently, a third animal model was developed in specific-pathogen-free chickens [ 12] to study the avian strains of HEV and the HS syndrome associated with avian HEV infection [ 13].
